item.dc:creator: Lale Davidson
item.description: Hi Tracy, LSQ asked me to join their blogosphere, so I was checking it out. This post is as deeply smart as it is smartly written. This point in particular was eye opening: "With rare exceptions, this sci-fi shorthand has taught viewers to see natural spaces, organic lines, and bursts of physical color as primitive. Indeed, ‚Äútech-washing‚Äù is as real as whitewashing in sci-fi storytelling. When deployed within narratives meant to represent a minority perspective and experience, it can be similarly damaging." Great link to Ebony's article on Afrofuturism, too. Very impressed.
